description: Creation of additional storey to existing two storey detached dwelling with a maximum height of 8.25 metres
decision_conditions: The creation of an additional storey to the existing two storey detached dwelling would, by reason of its height, scale, bulk and mass, appear overbearing, dominant and visually intrusive in the rear garden environment and result in undue overlooking and loss of privacy harmful to the amenity of adjacent occupiers.Consequently, under the provisions of Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2020 [as amended], the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority is refused.

The creation of an additional storey to the existing two storey detached dwelling would, by reason of its height, scale, bulk and mass, appear incongruous and out of character in the rear garden environment harmful to the character and appearance of the surrounding area. Consequently, under the provisions of Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2020 [as amended], the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority is refused.

The existing dwelling is not lawful as it has not been built in accordance with the approved plans for planning application P0619.16. Consequently, under the provisions of Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2020 [as amended], the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority is refused.
